summary: This is an internal email from January 12, 2019, regarding a press inquiry from a New Yorker Magazine reporter about the Jeffrey Epstein case. The email relays that the reporter interviewed a victim who disclosed having sex with both Epstein and Alan Dershowitz, and that the reporter sought verification from an agent about travel to Australia for an interview.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the press inquiry and the case; a victim reportedly disclosed having sex with him.

persons.name: Allan Dershowitz
persons.context: Mentioned as someone a victim disclosed having sex with, alongside Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Both are named by a victim as individuals she had sex with, connecting them in the context of alleged abuse.

events.title: Press Inquiry from The New Yorker
events.description: A writer from The New Yorker Magazine contacts an agent on a personal cell phone regarding the Epstein case, interviewing a victim who made disclosures about Epstein and Dershowitz.

keyFacts: A New Yorker Magazine reporter contacted an agent in January 2019 regarding the Epstein case.
The reporter interviewed a victim who disclosed having sex with both Jeffrey Epstein and Alan Dershowitz.
The reporter sought verification that an agent traveled to Australia to interview the victim.
The email suggests anticipation of more frequent press inquiries about the case.
The correspondence indicates ongoing media investigation into Epstein's network in early 2019.
